snippet: Declining sales and a strong dollar bedeviled PepsiCo, the beverage and snacks giant, in the fourth quarter.
abstract: PepsiCo reports quarterly earnings decline of 24 percent in quarter ended in December 2014, with sales declining to $19.95, from $20.12 billion in year-ago period, for total earnings of $1.3 billion; income is reported as $1.6 billion after adjusting for extraordinary charges and currency swings.
lead_paragraph: Declining sales and a strong dollar bedeviled PepsiCo, the beverage and snacks giant, in the fourth quarter.

headline.main: Currency Swings Help Push Down PepsiCo Earnings by 24%
headline.print_headline: Currency Swings Help Push Down PepsiCo Earnings by 24%
